thread.title: Arumainayagam recalls 1977 dinner date with Pele
thread.title_full: Arumainayagam recalls 1977 dinner date with Pele - The Times of India

author: Maxin Mathew
title: Arumainayagam recalls 1977 dinner date with Pele
text:
Bengaluru: As football fanatics across the country descended on Kolkata to welcome one of the sport's biggest legends, nearly 2,000 km away in Bengaluru, Isaiah Arumainayagam had to be content watching the action unfold on his television set, clutching a collection of photographs that captured his meeting with Edison Arantes do Nascimento, or as the world knows him, Pele.

The 74-year-old Brazilian's first visit to India was in 1977, when he came to Calcutta (as the city was then called) with the New York City Cosmos team to play an exhibition game against Mohun Bagan. Arumainayagam, or 'Orumai' as he was affectionately called in Kolkata during his stint with Bagan from 1961-68, was playing for Southern Railway in Chennai when Pele came calling 38 years ago.

"I still remember the date â€” September 22, 1977," Arumainayagam, a member of the gold medal-winning Indian team at the 1962 Jakarta Asian Games, told TOI. "I got a phone call from a member of the Mohun Bagan management who invited me to a meeting with Pele over dinner after the exhibition match. I couldn't believe what I was hearing. It took a lot of time to sink in."



For someone who has idolized Brazil and Pele all his life, it was a dream come true for Arumainayagam. "I told the late Tamil actor R Muthuraman that I was going to meet Pele. He was busy shooting for a film at that time, but being a big football enthusiast, he postponed the shoot and agreed to come with me," he recalled.

After watching the exhibition game at the Eden Gardens, Arumainayagam and Muthuraman went to the Grand Hotel for the dinner party. "Pele smiled warmly when we greeted him and shook hands. He wasn't fluent in English at that time, so we couldn't have much of a conversation. But he had been briefed about all our achievements. Muthuraman gifted him a couple of Kanjeevaram sarees for his wife which Pele was very happy to accept. It is a moment I will cherish forever," Arumainayagam recounted.

As the country counts the hours for Pele's second trip to India, the 74-year-old Arumainayagam wishes there was a way to meet him again. "I wish I could go again and shake hands with the greatest footballer ever..."
